ygData.subject: RE: Bards and rubicite
ygData.msgSnippet: The only reason I want rubicite is that I graduated from the University of Alabama and the color of rubicite is our team color (crimson):-).  The breastplate
ygData.messageBody:
The only reason I want rubicite is that I graduated from the University of
Alabama and the color of rubicite is our team color (crimson):-). The
breastplate is the only piece I want. Combined with steel for all the other
pieces, I think that would look pretty cool. Call me vain but with a CHR of
115 it fits my character:-). Based on the horror stories I've read about
camping for rubicite, must admit I do not look forward to ever doing it.

Galtin of E'ci

Roll Tide!!
Bama 40
Gators 39


> my bard doesnt have one piece of rubicite on him, and im proud of that
> fact,
> i cant stand cazic, so many jerks in that zone its sickening, the only
> reason im looking for rubicite is for my rogue friend, which has a silvery
> war axe to spare for rubi if i trade mine off, i also have Hatar's fine
> silk
> turbin which im trying to pawn off for some rubi for him, but no takers on
> that either...
>
> Minkin Nehoc
> Sol Ro
> Level 35 bard in full steel and other plates that look like steel
>
>
> > Talies,
> >
> > Wondering where you heard this rumor from? I read on EQVault that
> rogues
> > and shamans were soon going to lose the ability to wear rubicite but saw
> > nothing about bards being included. This may end up being a moot point
> if
> > the Solusek bard quests give bard unique armor. I think I would prefer
> > doing the quests, no matter how hard, versus camping for rubicite.
> >
> > Galtin of E'ci
> >
> > > And just because some of you actually read my messages, here is
> today's
> > > secret: Get your rubicite armour while you still can.
> > >
> > >
> >
> > > Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to
> toren@...
> > with the subject lol.
>
> > Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to toren@...
> with the subject lol.
